content: chain 2 turn row 6 increase double_crochet in each st across increase in last st 52 54 54 54 total double_crochet assembly see diagram in the images section for visuals on how to stitch lay out the top/sole portion of the slipper fold the top portion over onto the sole portion the fold should be where the skinniest section of the piece is the fold is the toe of your slipper stitch the sides of the top section to the sides of the sole i like to use mattress stitch for this to make the seam as flat as possible but you could also slip_stitch if you wanted to just be aware that the seam might be more noticeable when wearing them after felting the back piece should be shaped like a trapezoid attach the longest side of the back piece to the remaining portion of the sole that does not have anything stitched to it once that is done attach the short sides of the back piece to the outside edges of the top portion of the slipper weave in all of the ends this doesn t have to be super neat because it will all felt together after washing border options - follow border instructions and then leave the border as is while doing the washing/shaping process you can roll of down and let it dry that way if you want - follow the border instructions and then fold the border over on itself and stitch it down with a mattress stitch to make for a thicker border this is the option shown in photos below - skip my border instructions and use your own finishing technique after stitching together the top sole and back turn the slipper right side out and make a slip knot with whatever color you want to use for the edge of the foot hole and anchor it to the right side of the slipper where the back section is stitched to the top of the slipper round 1 chain 2 double_crochet around the perimeter of the foot hole slip_stitch into first double_crochet round 2 chain 2 double_crochet in each double_crochet slip_stitch into first double_crochet round 3 ch2 double_crochet in each double_crochet slip_stitch into first double_crochet felting and shaping put the slippers in the washing machine adding towels to the wash may help to add friction as well optionally slippers can be placed inside a pillowcase or garment bag before being placed in the wash to help with friction run the wash on the hottest setting check slippers after running once they should be starting to get fuzzy repeat wash cycles until slippers have shrunk to desired size after each cycle check the slippers and gently shape with your hands if they get misshapen you can put a plastic bag over your foot and try on the slipper over the bag while they are still wet to check for size if the slippers are taking a while to shrink one thing you can
